ClassDesc: starting with Android Wear 2.0 we no longer encourage bi-directional spacial models for apps. If you are looking to implement vertical paging pattern, consider using the https:##developer#android#com@B_android#support#v7#widget#SnapHelper_E@ and a https:##developer#android#com@B_android#support#v7#widget#RecyclerView_E@ instead. A page indicator for https:##developer#android#com@B_android#support#wearable#view#GridViewPager_E@ which identifies the current page in relation to all available pages on the current row. Pages are represented as dots. The current page can be highlighted with a different color or size dot. The default behavior is to fade out the dots when the pager is idle (not settling or being dragged). This can be changed with https:##developer#android#com@B_android#support#wearable#view#DotsPageIndicator#setDotFadeWhenIdle_E@. Use https:##developer#android#com@B_android#support#wearable#view#DotsPageIndicator#setPager_E@ to connect this view to a pager instance.
